Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for storage capacity, performance, and redundancy. Identify the applications and workloads that will use Azure Elastic SAN.
Design the storage architecture, including the configuration of storage pools, volume groups, and integration with existing Azure resources.
Provision an Azure Elastic SAN resource in the Azure portal or using Azure CLI/PowerShell. Specify the required storage capacity and performance tier.
Set up storage pools within the Azure Elastic SAN resource. Allocate capacity and performance levels based on workload requirements.
Create volumes within the storage pools and configure them with appropriate access policies, encryption, and redundancy settings.
Enable encryption for data at rest and in transit. Configure access controls, including role-based access control (RBAC) and network security rules.
Integrate Azure Elastic SAN with other Azure services, such as Azure Virtual Machines or Azure Kubernetes Service, to enable seamless storage access.
Perform thorough testing of storage performance, connectivity, and failover scenarios to ensure the setup meets the required specifications.
Set up monitoring and alerting using Azure Monitor to track storage performance, capacity usage, and potential issues.
Document the storage architecture, configurations, and operational procedures. Share the documentation with relevant stakeholders.
Conduct training sessions for the operations team on managing and troubleshooting Azure Elastic SAN.
Develop and implement a backup and recovery plan for the data stored in Azure Elastic SAN. Test the plan to ensure reliability.
Conduct regular audits to ensure compliance with organizational and regulatory requirements. Verify security and performance settings.
Continuously monitor storage performance and optimize configurations as needed to meet changing workload requirements.
Use Azure Monitor to continuously track the health and performance of Azure Elastic SAN. Identify and address any anomalies or potential issues.
Verify the security settings of Azure Elastic SAN, including encryption at rest and access controls. Ensure compliance with organizational security policies.
Test backup and restore processes to ensure data integrity and availability in case of failures or disasters.
Conduct regular audits of Azure Elastic SAN configurations to ensure alignment with best practices and organizational requirements.
Analyze storage usage trends and plan for capacity upgrades or optimizations to meet future demands.
Review and update security policies for Azure Elastic SAN to adapt to changes in the threat landscape or organizational requirements.
Perform failover tests to verify the resiliency of Azure Elastic SAN and ensure that redundant paths function correctly during outages.
Analyze performance metrics and implement optimizations to ensure Azure Elastic SAN operates within expected parameters.
Evaluate Azure Elastic SAN's performance against the SLA. Address any deviations or issues with Microsoft support.
Conduct incident response drills to prepare the team for potential security incidents or storage outages. Ensure familiarity with procedures and protocols.
Collect and analyze user feedback regarding Azure Elastic SAN performance and reliability. Implement continuous improvements based on this feedback.
